<small>Aramaic form: [[H5330]]</small>
 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָצַח‎</span>] **verb** ==be pre-eminent, enduring== (Ecclus [Pi\`el] ***make brilliant*** [[Eccl.43.5|Eccl 43:5]]; [[Eccl.43.13|Eccl 43:13]] [?] (compare Oxford ed.<sup>xxxiii</sup>); Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָצַח‎</span> ***conquer***, etc.; Phoenician <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נצח‎</span>, Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נְצַח‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***shine, be illustrious, pre-eminent, victorious***; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be pure, reliable***; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be pure, innocent***; both classes of meaning probably derived form ***shine, be bright, brilliant***, see also [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>[[1Sam.15.29|1Sam 15:29]]</sup>); — 

**Niph\`al** ***Participle active*** feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִצַּ֫חַת‎</span> [[Jer.8.5|Jer 8:5]] ***enduring*** (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְשֻׁבָה‎</span> ***apostasy***).

**Piel** = ***act as overseer, superintendent, director***, only Chronicles and Psalm-titles; — ***Infinitive*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְנַצֵּחַ‎</span> [[1Chr.15.21|1Chr 15:21]] + 4 t.; participle <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַמְנַצֵּחַ‎</span> [[Hab.3.19|Hab 3:19]]; [[Ps.4.1|Ps 4:1]] + 54 t. Psalms; ***plural*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְנַצְּחִים‎</span> [[2Chr.2.1|2Chr 2:1]]; [[2Chr.2.17|2Chr 2:17]]; [[2Chr.34.13|2Chr 34:13]] — 

**1.** in building temple [[2Chr.2.1|2Chr 2:1]]; [[2Chr.2.17|2Chr 2:17]]; [[Ezra.3.8|Ezra 3:8]]; [[Ezra.3.9|Ezra 3:9]], compare [[2Chr.34.12|2Chr 34:12]]; [[2Chr.34.13|2Chr 34:13]]. 

**2.** in ministry of house of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> [[1Chr.23.4|1Chr 23:4]]. 

**3.** in liturgical service of song, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עלהֿשׁמינית‎</span>, over the bass voices, leading them with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּנֹּרוֺת‎</span> [[1Chr.15.21|1Chr 15:21]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַמְנַצֵּחַ‎</span> in titles Psalms has probably simile meaning, = ***musical director*** or ***choirmaster***; Greek [[BDB#Vrss|Vrss.]] of  2nd cent. A.D., [[BDB#Aq|Aq]] [[BDB#Theod|Theod]] Sym, and so [[BDB#Jer|Jerome]], think of Aramaic ***victorious***, but no clear explanation; [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">εἰς τὸ τέλος</span> (probably <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַמִּנְצָח‎</span>) follows ordinary meaning of noun <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֵצַח‎</span>, which may be explained in eschatological sense as referring to end of age of world after Euseb [[BDB#Theod|Theod]]; or for ***full rendering*** after [[BDB#De|De]]; neither satisfactory. Chronicles, near in date, gives the clue which is intrinsically probably: <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> indicates, not assignment (nothing special in these Psalms to suggest it, and assignment of Psalms for such use a matter of course), but that these Psalms were taken by final editor from an older major Psalter known as the Director's Collection, compare the still earlier collections known as <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎(ל)דוד‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎(ל)אסף‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎(ל)בני קרח‎</span>. The 55 Psalms with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎למנצח‎</span> were taken 39 from Davidic, 9 from Korahite, and 5 from Asaphic Psalters; only 2 anonymous. [[Hab.3|Hab 3]] originally belonged to Director's Psalter. This and other Director's Psalms have musical directions in titles. The Director's Psalter was probably the prayer-book of synagogue of Greek period, presupposed by our Hab., the collection of the twelve Minor Prophets, the prophetic canon, and Daniel (see [[BDB#Br|Br]]<sup>Gen. Intr. 123</sup>).
